text: This is just a guess, but I'd assume this was the browser unloading the tab to save RAM, and scrambling to get it back! I feel like I've heard of browsers doing such things... but usually it appears from the user's point of view like a full refresh. For it not to have that behaviour the tab would have had to be snapshotted to disk or something...
